# Rabies Incidence  
  
Rabies incidence has been estimated through exhaustive contact tracing activities in Serengeti District since 2002. Contact tracing involves identifying possible animal Rabies cases and human Rabies exposures, and interviewing those connected to confirm suspect status. A tissue sample is also taken from the deceased animal if suitable, for subsequent testing: a rapid diagnostic kit is used in-situ, with full laboratory test and genetic sequencing completed later.  
  
Please scroll down for data on our rabies incidence monitoring activities over the years, including maps of suspected and lab-confirmed animal Rabies cases.

```{r, echo=FALSE, include=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
script_district = "Serengeti"
```


```{r, echo=FALSE, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE}
# Set plot params
start_date_1 <- "2001-12-31"
start_month_1 <- 1
start_date_2 <- "2011-12-31"
diff_in_days = difftime(strptime(start_date_2, format = "%Y-%m-%d"), strptime(start_date_1, format = "%Y-%m-%d"), units = "days")
start_month_2 <- (floor(as.double(diff_in_days)/365))*12 
end_date <- Sys.Date()

# Find maximum number of bitten animals/bite victims for y-axis for each district
y_axis_max_2002 <- find_y_max(human_dataframe=human_epi_month, animal_dataframe=animal_epi_month, start_month=start_month_1, type="epi")
y_axis_max_2012 <- find_y_max(human_dataframe=human_epi_month, animal_dataframe=animal_epi_month, start_month=start_month_2, type="epi")
```

### Comparison of exposures and cases {.tabset .tabset-pills}  
  
#### 2002 to present
``` {r, echo=FALSE}
epi_plot(human_dataframe=human_epi_month, animal_dataframe=animal_epi_month,
         district=script_district, start_date=start_date_1, start_month=start_month_1,
         
         end_date=end_date, max_y=y_axis_max_2002)
```

### Summary
Please `r embed_data(district="Serengeti", label="click here")` to download an .xlsx file that gives a summary of animal cases and human exposures in Serengeti District from 2002 to `r substr(Sys.Date(), 1,4)`.

### Location of animal Rabies cases  
  
The map below gives the location of suspect and lab-confirmed animal Rabies cases that our team has traced in Serengeti District over the last five years.  
This map excludes all bites where the Rabies status is not suspect or cannot be determined; village centroids are used in the case of absent coordinates. Please select from the dropdown menu to view data from a specific year:  

```{r droplink, echo=FALSE}
# Create table
table_site <- c("html/ser_epi_map_2018.html", "html/ser_epi_map_2017.html",
                "html/ser_epi_map_2016.html", "html/ser_epi_map_2015.html",
                "html/ser_epi_map_2014.html")
names(table_site) <- c("2018", "2017", "2016", "2015", "2014")

bsselect(table_site, type = "iframe", frame_height=550, style="btn-primary", show_tick=TRUE, height=0)
```
